snippet.title: Brian Lesser, who oversaw billions in ad spending at GroupM, is leaving for a new job at AT&T
snippet.content:
Brian Lesser, North American CEO at the ad buying giant GroupM, is leaving for a new job at AT&T.
Lesser, who oversaw billions in ad spending at the WPP-owned media agency, . GroupM oversees more than $US100 billion in marketers' ad budgets.
Prior to that, he was instrumental in the agency's embrace of 'programmatic' ads, helping build and run the GroupM specialty buying unit Xaxis.
Lesser joins AT&T in a new role at an intriguing time. The company is seeking approval of a one that could have massive implications for the media and advertising industries.
To date, AT&T has been something of a sleeping giant in advertising. The company at one point had built and in house mobile ad network, which it eventually shuttered. More recently it has focused on using the to help advertisers target . With Lesser's hiring, it appears the telecom firm may be looking to take its ad game up a notch.
